contextId.information: "1/2 a shekel of silver." Translators may use a unit of measure that people understand and a round number: "5.5 grams of silver" or "six grams of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])

There were evidently shekels of more than one weight at the time. This specified which one was to be used. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:11|30:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])
contextId.quote: the weight of the shekel of the sanctuary

contextId.information: A talent is 34 kilograms. AT: "The workers cast 100 talents of silver" or "The workers cast 3,400 kilograms of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: One hundred talents of silver were cast
